alert.note: Alert for Churchill; Lyon; Mineral (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 18 at 5:04PM PDT by NWS Reno
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM PDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of west central Nevada and western Nevada, including the following counties, in west central Nevada, Churchill. In western Nevada, Lyon and Mineral. * WHEN...Until 700 PM PDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water on Hwy 95 is possible. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 502 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Us 95 At Lyon-Churchill Co Line. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
